comments.author: UniversalContinuity

captions.text:
If Viacom are the most throbbing, serpentine
cockheads in contemporary media, then GameTrailers.com...

are their shaft and balls. Given their plummeting
site traffic and rapidly mounting irrelevance,

it almost feels like kicking a sick puppy
to pick on 'poor GameFailers', but to fail

to point out the dubious activities of this
conglomeration of cuntflappery would reek

of intellectual dishonesty. Particularly when
this reprobate behavior accounts for the steady

disappearance of a sizable percentage of their
vanishing userbase.

While the runaway AdBlock bullet-train has
claimed more than a few undeserving victims,

the flagging fortunes of GameFailers.com is
a textbook case of karmic retribution.

I'll admit it: I not only used to avail myself
of GameFailers' services, I did so daily.

Their design in 2007 was a thing of beauty:
Feature-rich but streamlined, filled to the

brim with original content and exclusive developer
interviews long before YouTube got its shit

together. But that was all surface level.
Indulging further in penile puns, it was only

after penetrating the surface that you realized
the site was rotting from the inside. You

know those pre-roll ads on YouTube? Fucking
annoying, aren't they? To me, that's 90% of

the reason anyone ever installs AdBlock. And,
to a large extent, you can thank GameFailers

for the privilege. The MTV network's proprietary
video player - GameFailers very much included

- were one of the very first online cadres
to force its viewership to languish in pre-roll

commissary torment for have the audacity to
view one of their videos.

A price some might be willing to pay, were
the quality of the video content that succeeded

it remotely up to par. But, sadly, any credibility
GameFailers might have salvaged from the gaping

jaws of their own hubris... is immediately
squandered by their baffling inability to

remain stationary in the face of a hurricane
of advertiser hype.

Case in point: History remembers Resident
Evil 5 as a truly abysmal game unworthy of

the franchise's title... but you couldn't
tell that to GameTrailers, who were so swallowed

whole by the advertising Rancor that they
not only gave the game itself a glowing review

proclaiming it a modern masterpiece... they
preceded said review with a 6-part series

retrospective to carry the hype wave further
still!

The gaming press at large lost some major
brownie points with the release of Dragon

Age 2. But GameFailers took the avarice further
still by not only proclaiming that Dragon

Age 2 was nearly a perfect 10... but that
it had surpassed its predecessor in every

conceivable way! A fact other GameTrailers
journalists quarreled with the review's writer

over during a 2011 episode of Invisible Walls!
Alright, first we're gonna talk about Dragon

Age 2 so we can get Miguel's ass out of here.
So... what's up with that game, you gave it

a big score: 9.2.
Why?!

WHAT?!
Why?? I don't get it.

Ah, Miguel, mate look: I gotta--
Did you know opinions can be wrong?

--I gotta take issue with that. 9.2?!
Your taste is wrong. Go ahead.

Your opinion is.
And then, of course, there's the infamous

Mountain Dewmsday scenario involving Geoff
Keighley, Halo 4, Dorito's and a Siberian

supertanker of KY lubricant. The man has less
credibility than Melvin Dummar. I'm sure everyone

remembers the 'Angry Joe' incident from the
2010 VGA awards, in which neither Joe nor

Keighley had enough on-the-spot video game
knowledge to recall that Final Fantasy 14

had been released all of two months previously!
What MMOs should have been nominated for Game

of the Year this year?
There are soooooo many MMOS that, like, uh--

Dungeon Fighter Online! There's one example.
Uh... you could also, uh... what other games,

uh... Final Fantasy?!
Final Fantasy MMO?

Yeah.
This year?

Not this year. Not this year.
Exactly, it didn't come out this year.

♪ Liar! Oooooooooooohhh, nobody believes
me! ♪

♪ Liar! ♪
I don't have any problems with Angry Joe,

I made a few harmless jokes at the dude's
expense, but it's all in good fun. No harm

meant. But he's only a YouTube guy. His ignorance
is marginally excusable. Keighley is effectively

running what was - at the time - one of the
largest video game review sites in existence...

and he didn't know when the latest Final Fantasy
title had been released! Are you shitting

me?!
And what few members of their dwindling audience

weren't put off by their ass-backward review
scores, subpar research and eagerness to leap

headlong onto every hype train that rolled
into the moneystation... were forced to endure

site redesign... after agonizing redesign.
GameTrailers.com is the poster child for 'INABILITY

TO LEAVE ANYTHING THE FUCK ALONE-SYNDROME'.
Like an aging starlet on a cosmetic surgery

binge, in a seemingly endless feedback-loop
of vanishing functionality and degrading utility,

from one month to the next, GameFailers is
utterly indistinguishable from itself. And

not once for the better!
With YouTube partner sites offering the very

same footage, interviews and video review
content with half the headaches and aggravation...

the lumbering brachiosaur that is modern GameTrailers
seems oblivious to the Texas-sized meteorite

barreling toward the swamp. The way it's bleeding
revenue, interest and viewership, it may not

even live to see the impact.
And I repeat for posterity:

Karmic... Retribution.
I'm RazörFist.
God - fucking - SPEED!
